clinical_study.brief_title: Symbiotics to Prevent Postoperative Infection in Colorectal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Change in Incidence of Surgical Site Infection After Resection of Colorectal Cancer Between Patients Receiving a Symbiotic Compound and Patients Receiving a Placebo.

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

clinical_study.source: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

brief_summary.textblock: This is a double blind randomized trial in which patients with colorectal cancer undergoing surgery will be selected to receive either a symbiotic formulation or placebo. The researchers will compare incidence of surgical site infection between the study groups.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a double blind randomized trial in which patients with colorectal cancer undergoing surgery will be randomly selected to receive either a symbiotic formulation or placebo during the perioperative period. The researchers will compare incidence of surgical site infection, detected by clinical examination and complementary tests (CT scans, X-rays, microbiological and hematological tests) between the study groups.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with colorectal cancer on symbiotic to prevent postoperative infection
primary_outcome.description: This is a double blind randomized trial in which patients with colorectal cancer undergoing surgery will be selected to receive either a symbiotic formulation or placebo. After we will compare the number of participants with incidence of surgical site infection between the study groups.

intervention.description: this group received sachets of symbiotic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults between 18 and 85 years old;
- Colorectal cancer patients.
- Ability to understand and signing the informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy (early diagnosis)
- Reduced intellectual level that could prevent proper understanding of the objectives of the study
- Patients with rectal cancer undergoing neoadjuvant treatment (chemotherapy and radiotherapy)
- Use of products with prebiotic, probiotic and / or symbiotic function or fiber module; by more than 3x a week
- Refusal to participate and / or to sign the Consent Form Free and Clear
